titleStmt.title: Master Glyn his speech in Parliament, on Wednesday, the fifth of Ianuary, at the committee sitting in Guild-Hall concerning the breaches of the priviledges of Parliament, by breaking open the chambers, studies, and truncks of the sixe gentlemen, upon their accusation of high treason by His Majestie, 1641.
titleStmt.author: Glynne, John, Sir, 1603-1666.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: Newberry Library.
